stakeholders.name: Cai Jimmy
stakeholders.title: IT Director for APAC / Global Director of IT

salesforce.ae_next_steps: 12/02 BR Call with Jordan. 2 agencies still to pitch (Askphil and Wolfpack). Running through Payments and Biz case with him on 23rd

narratives.opp_summary: Bugaboo International B.V. is evaluating Shopify Plus for a multi-brand D2C migration starting with Artipoppe, with the intent to subsequently migrate Joolz and potentially Bugaboo itself. The deal is valued at $82,800 (Plus Standard) with $51M D2C GMV and a 3-year revenue impact of $841,500. The group is currently on Salesforce Commerce Cloud and is undergoing significant organizational restructuring — including acquisitions (Joolz), leadership changes, and a new co-CEO (Richard) — while simultaneously selecting a migration agency and negotiating an MSA structure with Shopify.
narratives.why_change: Bugaboo Group is consolidating multiple brands (Bugaboo, Artipoppe, Joolz) under a single umbrella following acquisitions, and needs a unified, scalable commerce platform to support this multi-brand strategy. The current Joolz agency (Wolfpack) is being terminated, indicating dissatisfaction with existing vendor relationships. Artipoppe is migrating to NetSuite on the ERP side, suggesting broader digital transformation. There is an implicit Salesforce Commerce Cloud contract end date driving the evaluation, with Jordan explicitly stating 'when this Salesforce contract ends' there's no reason they wouldn't migrate. Organizational changes (new co-CEO Richard, new Artipoppe GM) create a decision window where leadership wants to future-proof the tech stack.
narratives.why_shopify: The entire agency evaluation (Code, Flatline, AskPhill, Wolfpack) is centered around Shopify implementation, indicating Shopify Plus has already been selected as the target platform — the decision is about which agency will implement it, not whether to use Shopify. Jordan's champion behavior is evident: he is actively managing the agency selection process and coordinating with Ben Rees on contract structure. Ben has proactively proposed an MSA structure that allows multi-brand onboarding under a single legal framework. The agencies being evaluated are all dedicated Shopify agencies, reinforcing that the platform decision has effectively been made. External consultant Metis also recommended Shopify in their report.
narratives.why_now: The SFCC contract has a defined end date creating a natural decision point. Organizational restructuring — new co-CEO Richard in place, new Artipoppe GM hired, Joolz acquisition integration underway — means leadership is actively making infrastructure decisions now. Jordan indicated a realistic Q2 start with agency pitches expected to conclude by end of January. Ben suggested negotiating the Shopify contract within Q1 could be advantageous even if the project starts in Q2.
narratives.support_needed: 1) MSA/Legal framework preparation — Jordan agreed to MSA approach; Shopify legal needs to begin drafting. 2) Agency selection support — continued guidance on agency capabilities for the NetSuite integration. 3) NetSuite integration expertise — flagged as 'the most challenging bit' due to low internal IT capacity. 4) Engagement with Richard (co-CEO) — he can sign off the deal but Shopify hasn't engaged directly with him yet. 5) NRF in-person engagement — Jordan attending; opportunity to deepen relationship. 6) Q1 contract negotiation timing — late Jan/early Feb target for commercial terms discussion.

Q1.text: Have you identified the business reasons for the change?
Q1.notes: Consolidating brands and moving away from SFCC, but specific business reasons (cost savings, performance issues, revenue targets) are not quantified.
Q1.solution: Ask Jordan/Richard to articulate the business case — what ROI are they expecting?
Q1.action: Schedule discovery call focused on business metrics and expected outcomes

Q2.text: Are there specific quantifiable goals tied to the initiative?
Q2.notes: No specific quantifiable goals (conversion rate improvement, cost reduction, time-to-market targets) discussed. D2C GMV of $51M in Salesforce but not validated.
Q2.solution: Work with Jordan to define success metrics for the Artipoppe migration extensible to Joolz/Bugaboo.
Q2.action: Prepare business case framework with benchmark metrics from similar multi-brand migrations

Q3.text: Does the customer acknowledge a need for change?
Q3.notes: Jordan explicitly stated 'when this Salesforce contract ends... there's no reason we wouldn't migrate.' Entire agency evaluation is Shopify-focused.

Q4.text: Is there a clear understanding of the cost of inaction?
Q4.notes: Implied that staying on SFCC is undesirable and incumbent agency is being terminated, but explicit business impact of NOT migrating not articulated.
Q4.solution: Ask what happens if they stay on SFCC — contract cost, opportunity cost, consolidation delays.
Q4.action: Include cost of inaction analysis in next business case discussion

Q5.text: Is there a compelling event driving urgency?
Q5.notes: SFCC contract end date referenced but not specified. Organizational restructuring creates implicit urgency. Compelling Event field in Salesforce is null.
Q5.solution: Pin down the SFCC contract end date and any board-mandated timeline.
Q5.action: Ask Jordan for exact SFCC renewal/end date and board deadlines

Q6.text: Have the metrics been validated with the customer?
Q6.notes: Metrics have not been formally validated — conversation has been about agency selection and contract structure, not business outcomes.
Q6.solution: Shift next call to include business metrics validation with Jordan and ideally Richard.
Q6.action: Prepare metrics validation discussion for next sync

Q7.text: Are the metrics compelling enough to drive urgency?
Q7.notes: Multi-brand consolidation story and SFCC departure are directionally compelling but lack quantified urgency.
Q7.solution: Quantify cost of running multiple platforms vs. consolidated Shopify MSA.
Q7.action: Build TCO comparison (SFCC multi-brand vs. Shopify MSA)

Q1.text: Has the Economic Buyer been identified?
Q1.notes: Cai Jimmy (IT Director APAC / Global Director of IT) listed as EB. Richard (co-CEO) also referenced as someone who 'can sign this off.'
Q1.solution: Clarify whether Jimmy Cai or Richard is the true final signatory — possible dual authority.
Q1.action: Ask Jordan to confirm the approval chain

Q2.text: Is the EB the right person who can sign off on the deal?
Q2.notes: Jimmy Cai listed as EB but Richard (co-CEO) described as decision-maker who 'can sign this off.' Unclear who literally signs the contract.
Q2.solution: Validate contract signatory during MSA discussion.
Q2.action: Confirm signatory authority when initiating MSA legal review

Q3.text: Have you had direct access to the EB?
Q3.notes: Jimmy Cai attended November 2025 group call. Richard has not appeared on any Shopify calls. Access to Jimmy exists; access to Richard is through Jordan.
Q3.solution: Request introduction to Richard through Jordan.
Q3.action: Propose introductory call with Richard to discuss MSA approach and multi-brand vision

Q4.text: Is the champion willing to facilitate access to the EB?
Q4.notes: Jordan indicated willingness ('it's good that we've got Richard in place now') and Jimmy already participated in a call.

Q5.text: Do you understand the EB's personal priorities?
Q5.notes: Jordan described Richard as 'extremely impulsive' wanting multi-brand consolidation. Jimmy's specific priorities unknown.
Q5.solution: Prepare tailored messaging for Richard focusing on speed, simplicity, and multi-brand scalability.
Q5.action: Create executive briefing doc for Richard

Q6.text: Do you understand the budget and approval process?
Q6.notes: No discussion of budget allocation, approval process, or budget authority.
Q6.solution: Understand budget process — capex, opex, or board-approved investment.
Q6.action: Ask Jordan about budget allocation process and approval thresholds

Q1.text: Is the decision-making process clearly understood?
Q1.notes: Agency selection process is clear (4 agencies pitching). Broader organizational approval process not fully mapped.
Q1.solution: Map full decision process from agency selection → Shopify contract → project kickoff.
Q1.action: Ask Jordan to walk through decision chain: Who approves agency? Who approves contract? Board approval needed?

Q2.text: Are all key decision makers identified?
Q2.notes: Jordan, Richard, Jimmy Cai, and Jurryt van Arend identified. Unknown if procurement, finance, or other stakeholders are involved.
Q2.solution: Confirm full buying committee including procurement or finance stakeholders.
Q2.action: Ask Jordan if procurement or finance teams will be involved in contract review

Q3.text: Is there a defined timeline for the decision?
Q3.notes: Agency pitches conclude end of January, Q2 project start, close date April 23, 2026.
Q3.action: Confirm timeline still holds in next sync

Q4.text: Are there any events driving the timeline?
Q4.notes: SFCC contract end and organizational restructuring drive timeline, but no single hard deadline explicitly confirmed.
Q4.solution: Pin down SFCC contract end date as primary timeline driver.

Q5.text: Is the current solution / status quo clearly understood?
Q5.notes: Currently on SFCC with Wolfpack for Joolz. Both being replaced. Prior attempts actively being dismantled.

Q6.text: Has the 'do nothing' scenario been explored?
Q6.notes: Jordan implied staying on SFCC is not viable, but explicit consequences not fully explored.
Q6.solution: Articulate the 'do nothing' scenario — fragmentation costs.
Q6.action: Include cost-of-inaction discussion in business case

Q7.text: Has the decision process been validated with multiple stakeholders?
Q7.notes: Jordan described process informally. No formal mutual validation with Richard or Jimmy.
Q7.solution: Validate process with Richard or Jimmy during intro call.
Q7.action: Confirm decision process and timeline during Richard intro call

Q1.text: Are the decision criteria clearly defined?
Q1.notes: Agency evaluation criteria partially visible. Platform-level criteria not explicitly discussed — Shopify is the assumed platform.
Q1.solution: Confirm Shopify definitively selected and understand remaining criteria.
Q1.action: Ask Jordan if any remaining platform evaluation criteria exist or if it's purely agency selection

Q2.text: Have all potential solutions been explored?
Q2.notes: Only D2C discussed. B2B and Retail GMV null. POS and omnichannel not explored. Payments GPV is $0.
Q2.solution: Explore B2B, wholesale, and retail needs.
Q2.action: Schedule discovery around full commerce needs including B2B, POS, and omnichannel

Q3.text: Are there any technical or integration requirements?
Q3.notes: Jordan explicitly called out NetSuite integration as 'the most challenging bit' due to low IT capacity.
Q3.solution: Provide Shopify's perspective on NetSuite integration options.
Q3.action: Connect Jordan with Shopify integration resources or case studies

Q4.text: Is there an opportunity to expand the solution scope?
Q4.notes: Payments GPV $0, Payments Attached false. Payments not discussed in any calls.
Q4.solution: Introduce Shopify Payments as differentiator and cost saver.
Q4.action: Include Shopify Payments overview in next commercial discussion

Q5.text: Is there a mutual action plan in place?
Q5.notes: No formal MAP. Process managed informally through Jordan-Ben syncs.
Q5.action: Draft mutual action plan and share with Jordan for validation

Q6.text: Have you shaped the decision criteria in your favor?
Q6.notes: Ben has informally guided agency selection and proposed MSA structure. No formal criteria-shaping exercise done.
Q6.solution: More deliberately shape criteria around Shopify's multi-brand, integration, and ecosystem strengths.
Q6.action: Prepare 'why Shopify for multi-brand' positioning doc for Jordan to share internally

Q7.text: Do you know who defined the evaluation criteria?
Q7.notes: Unknown who defined agency/platform evaluation criteria.
Q7.solution: Understand if criteria defined by Jordan alone or with input from Richard/Jimmy.
Q7.action: Ask Jordan who set evaluation criteria and whether others have requirements

Q1.notes: Ben proposed MSA route, Jordan agreed. Jordan mentioned legal team 'want to look at this once.' Full procurement process not mapped.
Q1.solution: Map Bugaboo's procurement and legal review process.
Q1.action: Ask Jordan how long legal reviews typically take and who is involved

Q2.text: Are there any known redlines or deal-breakers?
Q2.notes: Jordan wants a break clause for Artipoppe engagement (exit if initial migration doesn't go well). This is a likely redline.
Q2.action: Discuss break clause feasibility with Shopify legal

Q3.text: Do you know how long the legal review will take?
Q3.notes: No information on Bugaboo's legal review timeline.
Q3.action: Include procurement timeline question in next sync

Q4.text: Is the total procurement timeline mapped?
Q4.action: Ask Jordan for typical contract turnaround time

Q5.notes: No contract details shared yet. Ben suggested starting MSA process but hasn't begun.
Q5.action: Begin MSA draft and share with Jordan for initial review

Q6.text: Has the contract been sent for review?
Q6.action: Draft MSA and initial sales order for Artipoppe

Q7.text: Is there a target signature date?
Q7.notes: Ben suggested Q1 contract negotiation. Jordan indicated end of January as good time. Close date April 23, 2026.
Q7.solution: Align on specific target signature date.
Q7.action: Propose target signature date in next conversation

Q1.text: Has the customer's core pain been identified?
Q1.notes: Multiple pains: SFCC platform fatigue, Wolfpack termination, multi-brand consolidation need, low IT capacity, NetSuite integration complexity.
Q1.action: Continue to document and validate pains

Q2.text: Have prior attempts to solve the problem been explored?
Q2.notes: Running on SFCC with Wolfpack for Joolz — both being replaced, indicating prior approaches failed.

Q3.text: Is the business impact of the pain quantified?
Q3.notes: Low IT capacity and organizational restructuring mentioned. Specific quantified business impact not discussed.
Q3.solution: Quantify business impact of current pains.
Q3.action: Ask Jordan what current tech stack fragmentation costs in time, money, opportunity

Q4.text: Is the pain felt across multiple teams/levels?
Q4.notes: Digital CX, IT team, and brand-level teams affected. Extent of impact per team not detailed.
Q4.solution: Map affected teams and specific pain points.
Q4.action: Include team-level pain mapping in discovery

Q5.text: Is there urgency to resolve the pain?
Q5.notes: Urgency from restructuring and SFCC timeline, but Jordan noted process has been 'slow because of change in company.' Mixed signals.
Q5.solution: Reinforce urgency by connecting platform decision to transformation timeline.
Q5.action: Frame Shopify migration as enabler of broader group consolidation

Q6.text: Are there alternative solutions being considered?
Q6.notes: SFCC is incumbent. Jordan's language strongly suggests departure. No other platform competitors mentioned.
Q6.solution: Ensure SFCC stay option is fully de-positioned.
Q6.action: Prepare TCO comparison and migration risk assessment vs. staying on SFCC

Q7.text: Is there a triggering event that created the pain?
Q7.notes: Organizational restructuring (acquisitions, new leadership) creates a 'now' moment, but not explicitly tied to hard deadline.
Q7.solution: Connect the 'why now' to a specific business milestone.
Q7.action: Ask what business milestone is the hard deadline

Q8.text: Can Shopify uniquely address the pain?
Q8.notes: Multi-brand MSA approach, strong agency ecosystem (Code, Flatline, AskPhill), and platform flexibility for phased migration uniquely position Shopify.
Q8.action: Reinforce multi-brand MSA advantage in all discussions

Q1.notes: Jordan Sykes (Head of Digital CX & Engineering) is the champion. Actively managing agency evaluation, coordinating with Ben, sharing internal insights, advocating for Shopify.
Q1.action: Continue to invest in Jordan as primary champion

Q2.text: Does the champion have organizational influence?
Q2.notes: Jordan has influence over agency and tech stack decisions but is 'still waiting to hear whether I even have an official position with Artipoppe.'
Q2.action: Check in on Jordan's Artipoppe role status in next sync

Q3.text: Is the champion sharing insider information?
Q3.notes: Jordan shares extensive internal insights: org restructuring, leadership changes, Wolfpack termination, agency dynamics, Richard's personality, IT constraints.
Q3.action: Continue building trust and information exchange

Q4.text: Does the champion have access to the EB?
Q4.notes: Jordan directly connected to Richard (co-CEO) and works alongside Jimmy Cai (EB). Stated 'it's good that we've got Richard in place now.'

Q5.text: Has the champion introduced you to the EB?
Q5.notes: Jordan has not yet introduced Ben/Shopify directly to Richard. Richard has not appeared on any calls.
Q5.action: Ask Jordan to set up introductory call with Richard

Q6.text: Is the champion actively selling internally?
Q6.notes: Jordan appears willing to advocate but hasn't explicitly brought Shopify into a buying group meeting. Shared that Richard can 'sign this off' but no formal intro.
Q6.solution: Ask Jordan about formal buying committee review and whether Shopify can present.
Q6.action: Propose group presentation or executive briefing with Richard and Jimmy

Q7.text: Does the champion have a personal reason to support Shopify?
Q7.notes: Jordan champions Shopify because: (a) believes in platform for multi-brand consolidation, (b) actively terminating incumbent agency, (c) wants unified tech stack for acquisitions, (d) professional stake in digital transformation success.
Q7.action: Continue supporting Jordan's vision and make him look good internally

Q1.notes: SFCC is listed as competitor but appears to be the incumbent being replaced rather than an active competitor. No other platforms mentioned — evaluation is between Shopify agencies.
Q1.solution: Confirm whether SFCC is actively being re-evaluated or departure is firm.
Q1.action: Ask Jordan if SFCC renewal is a realistic option

Q2.text: Has the 'do nothing' option been addressed?
Q2.notes: Jordan implies staying on SFCC is unattractive but not formally ruled out.
Q2.solution: Explicitly ask if staying on SFCC is on the table.

Q3.text: Is there an internal champion for a competitor?
Q3.notes: Wolfpack is being terminated. No visible SFCC advocate. Could theoretically stay on SFCC with different agency.
Q3.solution: Check if any stakeholder advocates for staying on SFCC.
Q3.action: Ask Jordan if anyone internally prefers SFCC

Q4.text: Are competitor strengths and weaknesses documented?
Q4.notes: SFCC being evaluated implicitly. The 'why leave' is implied but not explicitly detailed.
Q4.solution: Document specific SFCC shortcomings driving evaluation.
Q4.action: Ask Jordan for top 3 reasons for leaving SFCC

Q5.text: Is there a clear win strategy against the competition?
Q5.notes: Shopify strongly positioned — agency evaluation entirely Shopify-focused, Jordan championing. Risks: Jordan's role uncertainty, Richard's impulsive style, NetSuite integration.
Q5.solution: Mitigate risks by securing Richard engagement, demonstrating NetSuite capability, supporting Jordan.
Q5.action: Address all three risk factors in upcoming engagements
